Award.AwardTitle: Collaborative Research: Natural Seismicity Investigation of Active Continental Breakup in the Western Woodlark Basin
Award.AbstractNarration: In a suite of seismic experiments conducted in 1999 and 2000 microseismicity, regional and teleseismic earthquake events were recorded on an array of twenty seafloor instruments and 23 PASSCAL stations deployed on islands around the Western Woodlark Basin. Preliminary data analysis was completed in the original grant period, and this project will continue that effort. More data were collected than anticipated, and in particular, the preliminary receiver function data have proven a fertile source of information on regional crustal structure.
